com.soa.message

Interface MessageTransaction

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleTransaction

    public interface MessageTransaction
    Represents a transaction executed within the messaging system. A transaction may be implemented with more than one message exchange. Not all message exchanges are part of a transaction.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      TransactedExchange addExchange(java.lang.String exchangeId)
      Adds an exchange to the transaction.
      TransactedExchange getExchange(java.lang.String exchangeId)
      Returns the exchange in the transaction with the given ID (if present).
      java.util.List getExchanges()
      Returns an ordered list of exchange ID's that have been executed within the context of the transaction.
      java.util.Map getProperties()
      Provides direct access to the Map of properties for the transaction.
      java.lang.Object getProperty(java.lang.String name)
      Returns the property with the given name.
      java.util.Set getPropertyNames()
      Returns the names of the properties associated with the context.
      java.lang.String getTransactionID()
      Returns a unique identifier for a transaction.
      void setProperty(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Object property)
      Adds or replaces a property.

    • Method Detail

      • getTransactionID

        java.lang.String getTransactionID()
        Returns a unique identifier for a transaction.
        Returns:
        Unique identifier of the transaction.

      • getProperty

        java.lang.Object getProperty(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the property with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the property.
        Returns:
        Object holding the value of the requested property, null if none found.

      • setProperty

        void setProperty(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.Object property)
        Adds or replaces a property.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the property.
        property - Value of the property.

      • getPropertyNames

        java.util.Set getPropertyNames()
        Returns the names of the properties associated with the context. Changes made to the Set are reflected in the context, so if a name is removed from the Set, the property is removed from the context. Names cannot be added however.
        Returns:
        Set of String property names.

      • getProperties

        java.util.Map getProperties()
        Provides direct access to the Map of properties for the transaction.
        Returns:
        Map of properties keyed by Strings.

      • getExchanges

        java.util.List getExchanges()
        Returns an ordered list of exchange ID's that have been executed within the context of the transaction.
        Returns:

      • addExchange

        TransactedExchange addExchange(java.lang.String exchangeId)
        Adds an exchange to the transaction.
        Parameters:
        exchangeId - ID of the exchange.
        Returns:
        TransactedExchange instance that can be used to further describe the child exchange.

      • getExchange

        TransactedExchange getExchange(java.lang.String exchangeId)
        Returns the exchange in the transaction with the given ID (if present).
        Parameters:
        exchangeId - ID of the exchange.
        Returns:
        TransactedExchange describing the exchange, null if not found.
